intro: Podandrogyne trichopus, commonly known as the hairy podandrogyne, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Podandrogyne trichopus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
